column5: FRANKFURT Bayer  said on Tuesday said the European Commission had approved BASF  as a suitable buyer of the businesses Bayer will divest to win regulatory approval for the planned acquisition of Monsanto.

column4: Bayer wins approval to buy U.S. seed and ag chem giant Monsanto
column5: WASHINGTON  May 29 Bayer won U.S. antitrust approval for its planned takeover of Monsanto on Tuesday on condition that it sell about $9 billion in assets  the Justice Department said  clearing a major hurdle for the $62.5 billion deal.

column4: UPDATE 3-KWS seeks to buy Bayer's vegetable business  countering BASF
column5: * KWS offer is non-binding  financial terms not disclosed (Add comment from EU commission  background on review process )

column4: Bayer could get U.S. approval for Monsanto deal on Tuesday-source
column5: FRANKFURT  May 29 Bayer could be granted conditional U.S. antitrust approval for its planned takeover of Monsanto as soon as Tuesday  clearing a major hurdle for the $62.5 billion deal  a person familiar with the situation told Reuters.

column4: Novo Nordisk's oral diabetes drug beats Jardiance in study
column5: LONDON An experimental diabetes pill from Novo Nordisk proved better at lowering blood sugar levels than Eli Lilly and Boehringer Ingelheim's established Jardiance in a clinical study  the Danish drugmaker said on Tuesday.

column4: EMERGING MARKETS-Brazil stocks jump as traders see a bargain
column5: SAO PAULO  May 29 Brazilian equities bounced more than 2 percent on Tuesday  leading regional gains as traders searched for bargains after four straight sessions in the red  while the nation's real currency also outperformed other currencies in the region.     Brazil's benchmark Bovespa equities index had fallen some 8 percent over the previous eight days and plunged more than 4 percent on Monday alone as an eight-day trucker strike hit key sectors of the economy  even as there w

column4: Time is right for RBS share sale  bankers and analysts say
column5: LONDON The British government should go ahead and sell more shares in state-backed Royal Bank of Scotland   bankers and industry experts said  even though it would likely mean a big loss to taxpayers.

column4: RBS to stop financing new coal plants  oil sands or arctic oil projects
column5: LONDON Britain's Royal Bank of Scotland  said on Tuesday it had tightened restrictions on project finance and general lending for high-carbon energy projects and companies  joining other banks like HSBC  in shoring up its climate policies.

column4: Salesforce earnings beat on cloud strength  raises forecast
column5: Salesforce.com Inc  reported quarterly earnings on Tuesday that topped analysts' expectations and raised its full-year forecast as demand for its cloud-based sales and marketing software continues to propel rapid growth.

column4: UPDATE 3-Salesforce earnings beat on cloud strength  raises forecast
column5: May 29 Salesforce.com Inc reported quarterly earnings on Tuesday that topped analysts' expectations and raised its full-year forecast as demand for its cloud-based sales and marketing software continues to propel rapid growth.

column4: Salesforce quarterly revenue rises 25.4 pct
column5: May 29 Salesforce.com Inc reported a 25.4 percent rise in quarterly revenue on Tuesday  boosted by strong growth in its flagship Sales Cloud business. The company reported net income of $344 million  or 46 cents per share  in the first quarter ended April 30  compared with $1 million  or breakeven per share  a year earlier. Total revenue rose to $3.01 billion from $2.40 billion. (Reporting by Pushkala Aripaka in Bengaluru; Editing by Anil D'Silva)

column4: SandRidge fights back against Icahn over board control
column5: SandRidge Energy Inc  warned shareholders on Tuesday they would be handing control of the company too cheaply to activist investor Carl Icahn if they elect his new nominees to the board at an annual meeting next month.

column4: UPDATE 2-SandRidge fights back against Icahn over board control
column5: * SandRidge fell more than 15 pct since Icahn disclosed stake

column4: SandRidge says Icahn seeking control without paying premium
column5: May 29 SandRidge Energy Inc said on Tuesday activist investor Carl Icahn is seeking to gain control of the oil and natural producer without paying an appropriate premium or participating in a competitive process.

column4: Brazil denies Total license to drill Amazon basin for fourth time

column4: WellCare Health to buy Meridian Health Plans for $2.5 billion
column5: WellCare Health Plans Inc said on Tuesday it would buy Meridian Health Plans of Michigan and Illinois for $2.5 billion in cash to become the top Medicaid provider in those states.

column4: Alibaba leads consortium in $1.4 billion deal for stake in Chinese courier ZTO
column5: SHANGHAI Alibaba Group Holding Ltd  on Tuesday said it has led a consortium of investors to buy about 10 percent of Chinese courier ZTO Express (Cayman) Inc  for $1.38 billion  as part of the e-commerce firm's push into offline services.
